Contacts API Documentation¶

This documentation provides an overview of the Contacts API, its modules, and usage.

Contents¶

Schemas¶

Authentication Schemas¶

Authentication Schemas

This module defines the Pydantic models for authentication-related data structures.

class schemas.auth.Token(*, access_token: str, token_type: str)¶

Bases: BaseModel

Model representing an authentication token.

Attributes:

access_token (str): The access token string. token_type (str): The type of the token (e.g., “Bearer”).

access_token: str¶
model_config: ClassVar[ConfigDict] = {}¶

Configuration for the model, should be a dictionary conforming to [ConfigDict][pydantic.config.ConfigDict].

token_type: str¶
class schemas.auth.TokenData(*, username: str | None = None)¶

Bases: BaseModel

Model for token-related user data.

Attributes:

username (Optional[str]): The username extracted from the token, if available.

model_config: ClassVar[ConfigDict] = {}¶

Configuration for the model, should be a dictionary conforming to [ConfigDict][pydantic.config.ConfigDict].

username: str | None¶

Contact Schemas¶

Contact Schemas

This module defines the Pydantic models for managing contact-related data.

class schemas.contacts.ContactBase(*, first_name: str, last_name: str, email: EmailStr, phone_number: str, birthday: date, additional_data: str | None = None)¶

Bases: BaseModel

Base model for contact data.

Attributes:

first_name (str): The contact’s first name. last_name (str): The contact’s last name. email (EmailStr): The contact’s email address. phone_number (str): The contact’s phone number. birthday (date): The contact’s birthday. additional_data (Optional[str]): Additional notes or details about the contact.

additional_data: str | None¶
birthday: date¶
email: EmailStr¶
first_name: str¶
last_name: str¶
model_config: ClassVar[ConfigDict] = {}¶

Configuration for the model, should be a dictionary conforming to [ConfigDict][pydantic.config.ConfigDict].

phone_number: str¶
class schemas.contacts.ContactCreate(*, first_name: str, last_name: str, email: EmailStr, phone_number: str, birthday: date, additional_data: str | None = None)¶

Bases: ContactBase

Model for creating a new contact.

Inherits all attributes from ContactBase.

model_config: ClassVar[ConfigDict] = {}¶

Configuration for the model, should be a dictionary conforming to [ConfigDict][pydantic.config.ConfigDict].

class schemas.contacts.ContactOut(*, first_name: str, last_name: str, email: EmailStr, phone_number: str, birthday: date, additional_data: str | None = None, id: int)¶

Bases: ContactBase

Model for representing a contact in responses.

Attributes:

id (int): The unique identifier of the contact.

Inherits all attributes from ContactBase.

class Config¶

Bases: object

from_attributes = True¶
id: int¶
model_config: ClassVar[ConfigDict] = {'from_attributes': True}¶

Configuration for the model, should be a dictionary conforming to [ConfigDict][pydantic.config.ConfigDict].

class schemas.contacts.ContactUpdate(*, first_name: str | None, last_name: str | None, email: EmailStr | None, phone_number: str | None, birthday: date | None, additional_data: str | None = None)¶

Bases: BaseModel

Model for updating contact data.

Attributes:

first_name (Optional[str]): The contact’s first name. last_name (Optional[str]): The contact’s last name. email (Optional[EmailStr]): The contact’s email address. phone_number (Optional[str]): The contact’s phone number. birthday (Optional[date]): The contact’s birthday. additional_data (Optional[str]): Additional notes or details about the contact.

additional_data: str | None¶
birthday: date | None¶

User Schemas¶

User Schemas

This module defines the Pydantic models for user-related data structures.

class schemas.users.UserCreate(*, username: str, email: EmailStr, password: str)¶

Bases: BaseModel

Model for creating a new user.

Attributes:

username (str): The user’s username. email (EmailStr): The user’s email address. password (str): The user’s password.

email: EmailStr¶
model_config: ClassVar[ConfigDict] = {}¶

Configuration for the model, should be a dictionary conforming to [ConfigDict][pydantic.config.ConfigDict].

password: str¶
username: str¶
class schemas.users.UserInDB(*, username: str, email: EmailStr, password: str, hashed_password: str)¶

Bases: UserCreate

Model for representing a user in the database.

Inherits all attributes from UserCreate.

Attributes:

hashed_password (str): The hashed password of the user.

hashed_password: str¶
model_config: ClassVar[ConfigDict] = {}¶

Configuration for the model, should be a dictionary conforming to [ConfigDict][pydantic.config.ConfigDict].

class schemas.users.UserOut(*, id: int, username: str, email: EmailStr, created_at: datetime, email_confirmed: bool, avatar_url: HttpUrl | None)¶

Bases: BaseModel

Model for representing a user in responses.

Attributes:

id (int): The unique identifier of the user. username (str): The user’s username. email (EmailStr): The user’s email address. created_at (datetime): The datetime when the user was created. email_confirmed (bool): Whether the user’s email has been confirmed. avatar_url (Optional[HttpUrl]): The URL to the user’s avatar, if available.

class Config¶

Bases: object

from_attributes = True¶
orm_mode = True¶
avatar_url: HttpUrl | None¶
created_at: datetime¶
email: EmailStr¶
email_confirmed: bool¶
id: int¶
model_config: ClassVar[ConfigDict] = {'from_attributes': True, 'orm_mode': True}¶

Configuration for the model, should be a dictionary conforming to [ConfigDict][pydantic.config.ConfigDict].

username: str¶

Repositories¶

Contact Repository¶

Contact Repository Module

This module contains the Contact model and ContactRepository class for managing contacts in the database.

class repositories.contact_repository.Contact(**kwargs)¶

Bases: Base

SQLAlchemy model representing a contact.

Attributes:

id (int): Primary key of the contact. user_id (int): ID of the user who owns this contact. first_name (str): First name of the contact. last_name (str): Last name of the contact. email (str): Email address of the contact. phone_number (str): Phone number of the contact. birthday (datetime.date): Birthday of the contact. additional_data (str): Additional information about the contact.

additional_data¶
birthday¶
email¶
first_name¶
id¶
last_name¶
phone_number¶
user_id¶
class repositories.contact_repository.ContactRepository¶

Bases: IContactRepository

Repository class for managing contacts.

Methods:

get_all_by_user(user_id): Retrieves all contacts for a specific user. get_by_id_and_user(contact_id, user_id): Retrieves a specific contact by ID and user ID. create_for_user(contact, user_id): Creates a new contact for a specific user. update_for_user(contact_id, contact, user_id): Updates an existing contact for a specific user. delete_for_user(contact_id, user_id): Deletes a specific contact for a specific user. search_by_user(user_id, first_name, last_name, email): Searches contacts for a specific user. get_upcoming_birthdays_by_user(user_id): Retrieves upcoming birthdays for contacts of a user.

create_for_user(contact: ContactCreate, user_id: int)¶

Creates a new contact for a specific user.

Args:

contact (ContactCreate): The data for the new contact. user_id (int): The ID of the user.

Returns:

Contact: The created contact.

delete_for_user(contact_id: int, user_id: int)¶

Deletes a specific contact for a specific user.

Args:

contact_id (int): The ID of the contact to delete. user_id (int): The ID of the user.

Returns:

Contact: The deleted contact, or None if not found.

get_all_by_user(user_id: int)¶

Retrieves all contacts for a specific user.

Args:

user_id (int): The ID of the user.

Returns:

list[Contact]: List of contacts for the user.

get_by_id_and_user(contact_id: int, user_id: int)¶

Retrieves a specific contact by its ID and user ID.

Args:

contact_id (int): The ID of the contact. user_id (int): The ID of the user.

Returns:

Contact: The contact object, or None if not found.

get_upcoming_birthdays_by_user(user_id: int)¶

Retrieves upcoming birthdays for contacts of a user within the next 7 days.

Args:

user_id (int): The ID of the user.

Returns:

list[Contact]: List of contacts with upcoming birthdays.

search_by_user(user_id: int, first_name: str | None = None, last_name: str | None = None, email: str | None = None)¶

Searches contacts for a specific user based on optional filters.

Args:

user_id (int): The ID of the user. first_name (str, optional): The first name to search for. last_name (str, optional): The last name to search for. email (str, optional): The email address to search for.

Returns:

list[Contact]: List of contacts matching the search criteria.

update_for_user(contact_id: int, contact: ContactUpdate, user_id: int)¶

Updates an existing contact for a specific user.

Args:

contact_id (int): The ID of the contact to update. contact (ContactUpdate): The updated data for the contact. user_id (int): The ID of the user.

Returns:

Contact: The updated contact, or None if not found.

User Repository¶

User Repository Module

This module contains the User model and UserRepository class for managing users in the database.

class repositories.user_repository.User(**kwargs)¶

Bases: Base

SQLAlchemy model representing a user.

Attributes:

id (int): Primary key of the user. username (str): Username of the user. email (str): Email address of the user. hashed_password (str): Hashed password of the user. created_at (datetime.date): The date the user was created. email_confirmed (bool): Whether the user’s email is confirmed. avatar_url (str): URL of the user’s avatar. role (str): Role of the user, e.g., ‘user’ or ‘admin’.

avatar_url¶
created_at¶
email¶
email_confirmed¶
hashed_password¶
id¶
role¶
username¶
class repositories.user_repository.UserRepository¶

Bases: IUserRepository, IUserUpdateRepository

Repository class for managing users.

Methods:

get_by_username(username): Retrieves a user by their username. get_by_email(email): Retrieves a user by their email. create(user_data): Creates a new user in the database. mark_email_confirmed(user_id): Marks a user’s email as confirmed. get_by_id(user_id): Retrieves a user by their ID. update_avatar(user_id, avatar_url): Updates the avatar URL for a user. update_password(user_id, hashed_password): Updates the password for a user.

create(user_data: UserInDB)¶

Creates a new user in the database.

Args:

user_data (UserInDB): The data for the new user.

Returns:

User: The created user object.

get_by_email(email: str)¶

Retrieves a user by their email address.

Args:

email (str): The email address of the user.

Returns:

User: The user object, or None if not found.

get_by_id(user_id: int)¶

Retrieves a user by their ID.

Args:

user_id (int): The ID of the user.

Returns:

User: The user object, or None if not found.

get_by_username(username: str)¶

Retrieves a user by their username.

Args:

username (str): The username of the user.

Returns:

User: The user object, or None if not found.

mark_email_confirmed(user_id: int)¶

Marks a user’s email as confirmed.

Args:

user_id (int): The ID of the user.

update_avatar(user_id: int, avatar_url: str)¶

Updates the avatar URL for a user.

Args:

user_id (int): The ID of the user. avatar_url (str): The new avatar URL.

Returns:

User: The updated user object, or None if not found.

update_password(user_id: int, hashed_password: str)¶

Updates the password for a user.

Args:

user_id (int): The ID of the user. hashed_password (str): The new hashed password.

Raises:

HTTPException: If the user is not found.

Returns:

None

Clients¶

Cloudinary Client¶

Cloudinary Client Module

This module provides a client for interacting with the Cloudinary service to manage image uploads and deletions.

class clients.cloudinary_client.CloudinaryClient¶

Bases: IImageStorage

A client for Cloudinary that implements the IImageStorage interface.

Methods:

upload_image(file_path, options): Uploads an image to Cloudinary. delete_image(public_id): Deletes an image from Cloudinary.

delete_image(public_id: str) → Dict¶

Deletes an image from Cloudinary.

Args:

public_id (str): The public ID of the image to delete.

Returns:

Dict: The response from Cloudinary with deletion details.

upload_image(file_path: str, options: Dict | None = None) → Dict¶

Uploads an image to Cloudinary.

Args:

file_path (str): The local path to the image file. options (Dict, optional): Additional options for the upload.

Returns:

Dict: The response from Cloudinary with upload details.

FastAPI Mail Client¶

FastAPI Mail Client Module

This module provides a client for sending emails using FastAPI Mail.

class clients.fast_api_mail_client.FastApiMailClient¶

Bases: IEmailSender

A client for sending emails using FastAPI Mail that implements the IEmailSender interface.

Methods:

send_email(subject, recipients, body): Sends an email with the specified subject, recipients, and body.

async send_email(subject: str, recipients: List[EmailStr], body: str)¶

Sends an email with the specified subject, recipients, and body.

Args:

subject (str): The subject of the email. recipients (List[EmailStr]): A list of recipient email addresses. body (str): The body of the email.

Returns:

None

Redis Cache Client¶

Redis Cache Client Module

This module provides a client for interacting with Redis for caching purposes.

class clients.redis_client.RedisCache¶

Bases: ICache

A Redis client for caching that implements the ICache interface.

Methods:

get(key): Retrieves a value from the cache by its key. set(key, value, ttl): Stores a value in the cache with a time-to-live (TTL). delete(key): Deletes a value from the cache by its key.

async delete(key: str)¶

Deletes a value from the cache by its key.

Args:

key (str): The key of the value to delete.

Returns:

None

async get(key: str)¶

Retrieves a value from the cache by its key.

Args:

key (str): The key of the cached value.

Returns:

str: The cached value, or None if the key does not exist.

async set(key: str, value: str, ttl: int)¶

Stores a value in the cache with a time-to-live (TTL).

Args:

key (str): The key for the cached value. value (str): The value to cache. ttl (int): The time-to-live for the cached value in seconds.

Returns:

None
